result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. George G Myles

records.addlTxt: State's request for certified copies
Application for Jail Time Credit form
Defendant George G Myles in court with attorney Larry R Pruden.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Further proceedings scheduled for June 12, 2019 at 11:00 am.

2:30 pm FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR:  
ADA Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft George G Myles in court, in custody with Atty Larry R Pruden.  
State and Defense are confirming for trial.  
Defense has been provided with all discovery.  
State's witnesses are available.  
A report was done this week and a letter was sent by the State to Atty Pruden.  
State has certified copies of the Minutes / Bonds.  
Defense objects to Jurors being allowed to ask questions.  
Atty Leusink makes record as to offers that were made by the State.  
Atty Pruden presented an offer to the State.  
Atty Pruden advise that defendant is not accepting State's offer.  Mr. Myles confirms this.  
Court will seat 24 Jurors for voir dire.  There will be 2 alternate Jurors.  
No individual voir dire of Jurors by Attorneys except as outlined by the Court.  
Jury Instructions should be filed the Thursday before trial.  
A trial Information needs to be filed without any penalties.  
Atty Pruden advises that there needs to be a Denny hearing.  
The State will need to prepare an Order to Produce the witness for the Denny hearing.

02:30 PM  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft George G Myles in court, in custody with Atty Larry R Pruden.  
Matter is before the Court on a Motion to Suppress and also on joinder issues. 
State did file a response to the Motion.  Atty Pruden has seen State's response.  
2:32 pm Det. Troy Pagenkopf is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Leusink.
Exhibit #1 marked and identified as CD with recorded conversation with deft on 8-28-15.  
Exhibit #1 is offered and received.  A portion of Exhibit 1 is played for the Court.  
2:48 pm  Response by Atty Pruden to Court's questions.  
2:49 pm  Cross exam by Atty Pruden.  
2:54 pm  A portion of Exhibit 1 is played for the Court.  
2:54 pm  Continued cross exam by Atty Pruden.  
3:01 pm  Redirect of Det. Pagenkopf by Atty Leusink.  Atty Leusink plays further portion of Exhibit 1.  
3:08 pm  Continued redirect by Atty Leusink.  
3:08 pm  Recross by Atty Pruden.  
3:10 pm  No further redirect by Atty Leusink.  
3:10 pm  Response by Det. Pagenkopf to Court's questions.  
3:12 pm  Follow up questions by Atty Pruden.  
3:13 pm  Response by Det. Pagenkopf to Court's questions.  
3:13 pm  Atty Pruden would like to call the defendant as a witness.  Response by Court.  
3:14 pm  Atty Pruden asks for a moment to confer with Mr. Myles.  
3:14 pm  Atty Pruden asks further question of Court with regard to Goodchild.  
3:15 pm  Response by Court.  
3:15 pm  George Myles is sworn and testifies on exam of Atty Pruden.  
3:22 pm  Cross exam by Atty Leusink.  
3:25 pm  Redirect by Atty Pruden.  
3:26 pm  Response by defendant to Court's questions.  
3:26 pm  No follow up questions by Attys.  Witness excused.  
3:27 pm  Record is closed.  Argument by Atty Leusink.  
3:30 pm  Argument by Atty Pruden.  
3:34 pm  Court makes findings.  Court believes it is not a confined, custodial setting and not coercive.  Court finds Miranda was not necessary and it was voluntary.  Court declines to suppress the other statements that were made.  Miranda was waived and statements made were voluntary.  Court declines to suppress on any of the statements.  
3:40 pm  State is moving to join all 3 of defendant's cases for trial.  Response by Atty Pruden to Court's questions.  Deft says he couldn't get permission from his Parole Officer to get to Wisconsin in 2017.  3:42 pm  Response by Atty Leusink.  3:43 pm  Response by Mr. Myles to Atty Pruden's question regarding deft not being allowed permission to return to Wisconsin.  Argument by Atty Pruden in opposition to joinder.  3:46 pm  Response by Atty Leusink.  3:47 pm  Response by Court.  Deft responds to Court's questions with regard to seeking permission from PO to cross state line.  3:48 pm  Court believes there is proper joinder and will grant that.  If something new comes out of this before opening statements, Court will consider that.  
3:49 pm  Atty Pruden makes record as to statement he does not believe should be introduced.  Atty Leusink agrees it should not come in during State's case-in-chief.  Court agrees.  
3:51 pm  Atty Leusink makes record as to statements by 3 witnesses in WCJ.  He believes they are hearsay and could not come in.  3:52 pm  Response by Atty Pruden.  3:54 pm  Response by Court.  If there is hearsay, the State has a duty and a right to object.  3:54 pm  Court in recess.  **3:55 pm  Back on court record.  Appearances remain the same.  Atty Leusink asks to keep Exhibit 1 for trial preparation.  No objection by Atty Pruden.  Atty Leusink may hold the Exhibit until time of trial.

Defendant George G Myles in court, in custody with attorney Larry R Pruden.  Timothy A Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 10, 2019 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant George G Myles in court, in custody with attorney Larry R Pruden.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deft here on a detainer. Needs to be tried within 180 days of speedy detainer request. Minutes filed.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for April 22, 2019 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 11, 2019 at 02:30 pm.
Def. Exh. 1
Motion Opposing Joinder

Defendant George G Myles in court with attorney Larry R Pruden.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Herrmann moves to join both bail jump charges w/ 15CF434. Court reserves ruling on joinder until defense responds. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for February 18, 2019 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on February 15, 2019 at 01:15 pm.
State's Request for trial dates

Defendant George G Myles in court, in custody with attorney Larry R Pruden.  Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin. New offer provided to defense. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for April 5, 2019 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant George G Myles in court, in custody with attorney Larry R Pruden.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for February 11, 2019 at 01:15 pm.
Original Bond filed with Court.  Defendant refused to sign bond.
Original Warrant filed with the court.
Atty Larry Pruden

TOTAL BOND COVERS ALL FILES 18CF25, 16CF15 & 15CF434
Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH M.N. OR S.D.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant George G Myles in court, in custody via video with attorney Larry R Pruden.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for January 25, 2019 at 03:00 pm.
Atty Larry Pruden

Letter from IL DOC re: detainer

Defendant George G Myles not in court.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court Orders Judgment on bail/bond forfeiture. Minutes filed.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
2:30 pm FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR:  
3:17 pm  Case Called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Leslie Lynn Johnson appeared.  Defendant does not appear.  
Atty Johnson has not spoken with Mr. Myles since he was released on bail in August.  
Atty Johnson had a phone number for a friend of Mr. Myles who could get a hold of him.  
She advised that she was not able to reach him but left a message for him to be here today.  
Atty Johnson believes it was his client's intent to accept the State's offer.  
Court CANCELS the trial on this time and orders a warrant and bond forfeiture.

Defendant George G Myles in court with attorney Leslie Lynn Johnson.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State is moving to join files 15CF434 & 16CF15 for trial, no objection from Defense, Court Orders filed Joined. Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 13, 2017 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 4, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

Defendant George G Myles in court, in custody with attorney Leslie Lynn Johnson.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2017 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant George G Myles in court, in custody via video with attorney Leslie Lynn Johnson.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary Hearing requested within time period. Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 24, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
